column11: Review Text
A great day out sitting amongst sri Lankan people who were most friendly and as enthusiastically as ourselves was a scorching day and best of all we bewt the Australians
Witnessed the most remarkable cricket match between srilanka and india, where Srilanka srcured tournament victory after 26 years against India. I was a great day with ideal weather conditions.

Grand Stand top level was a good stand to watch. It's right above the dressing room. The stand gives free seating . But they don't oversell it so it will not be overcrowded. It costed 7500LKR per ticket for an ODI which is fine
A good place to watch a cricket match. It is a little difficult to get in when there is a match. If you go early it will be really helpful to get a good seat.

column8: This is one of the wonderful place to visit when there is a match held here.
column11: This is one of the greatest monuments made by a great leader of Sri Lanka. The game of cricket received  a great boost with this stadium. It contain all the facilities required for International Cricket stadium. Situated in Colombo the commercial capital of Sri Lanka, Visitors are enjoy th matches played here.
R. Premadasa International Cricket Stadium  is a cricket stadium on Khettarama Road, Maligawatta, Colombo, Sri Lanka It is the largest stadium in Sri Lanka with capacity of 35,000

It is a bug stadium with varied categories of seating. Accessability is easy and plenty of parking.Around the ground it is well protected and security is available in every gate. Yet the toilets are not good enough.
If you are a cricket lover must be at least to be visit once to see a limited over cricket match playing at this stadium. Plenty of seats and easily can see the match at every angle.

column8: Best Cricket ground in Sri Lanka
column11: This is the best place to watch cricket match in Sri Lanka. Day Night ground, A Upper is the best stand to watch

column8: Needs reviewing may have been hurried in war
column11: This stadium may be in the wrong area - fragility dry soils in old cities and too many ad hoc dwellers exarcebating city irritation due to this - moisture drying up higher up near this lower area in Colombo and stuffy too, stadiums artificial make it hard to breath - temporary artificial use a solution then back to natural use
Love this place nice an good place very good cricket place we are very fell this place highy reccoment that palce

I visited Sri Lanka with my wife in 2018 October. On our last day , while snaking around Colombo roads, I saw this historical stadium. I asked my tour driver if it can be visited and he talked to the guards outside. And we got in . We spent some good time sitting inside this massive stadium. The feeling is surreal . I would recommend this to every cricket fan. It worth it.
This is heart of cricket in sri lanka. Cricket is main sport of the nation and this is most imp statdium with lot of history
Cricket is the main sport of Sri Lanka and this is the most important ground in country with lots of history around it.
went there last year,and watched live T 20 match,can have beer inside,lots of fun,good calm place,space is good,good atmosphere with the decent cricket lovers,

It was known as Keththarama (‡∂ö‡∑ô‡∂≠‡∑ä‡∂≠‡∑è‡∂ª‡∑è‡∂∏) Cricket stadium prior to 1994. Built in 1986, this is the largest international stadium of the island that has seating facilities to 30,000 spectators. As of today, over 100 international Cricket matches has been hosted here with the most memorable one between Sri Lanka and India in which the world record was kept for the highest test total ‚Äì 952 for 6 declared by Sri Lanka in 1997-98.
Good centralized venue to hold international Cricket matches. The parking will be an issue so make sure you arrive there in a taxi. Beer and snacks are available for matches.
This is a modern International Cricket playground. It has the name of a Sri Lankan President. This is situated in Colombo city.
The stadium is well equipped for day & night matches with nice facilities for the public & players. The President box & Minister box are well placed to provide great view of field in action.

We visited  the Stadium to watch the only T20 match in 2018 between Sri Lanka and England in Colombo.  The end of the monsoon season did interrupt the game for a,little while but we were lucky to see the entire match.
I must say that Grand Stand has the coolest view all around and it brings you the most wonderful experience.
Visited to watch the Nidhas trophy final between India and Bangladesh and DK made it memorable with the last over finish. The stadium is nice and the crowd is also great. the atmosphere is electric.

This stadium is one of the many stadiums in Sri Lanka. This stadium is located in the city and is not very far from the Central Business District of the city. The pitch and the outfield are well maintained. On request and as we were from India, we were allowed inside the stadium. It's a big magnificent stadium. The grand stands are also very big. The pavilion is also magnificent. Once inside we remembered all the matches that we had seen on TV and having a first hand view it was very thrilling. Not a place to be missed, especially if you are a cricket fan.

I visited this stadium for the 5th ODI. A heavy police presence greets you, as you approach the stadium, which is situated in a run down area of Colombo. Tickets for the match, only became available from the official Sri Lankan Cricket Club site, a couple of weeks before the game.  Why do they advertise tickets so late, is beyond me, it's so frustrating! Large amounts of the ground were unavailable (for example behind the bowler's arm), presumably either pre-booked by tour companies, or reserved for the local fans. After being searched, I was allowed to enter the stadium and made my way to my seat, via the beer stall. The beer was sold in small beakers and was blooming awful.  The type of beer, you'd expect, on a very cheap, all inclusive holiday. The ground was about a tenth full, so there was no atmosphere at all.  The locals prefer T20. To make things worse, not only were England playing abysmally, I had some tiresome yobs, sitting close by, who kept shouting for any nearby fielding English player, to give them a wave.  If they did, then they got a cheer, if not, a boo and abuse. It was not good natured banter, but just boring and moronic. The highlight was the Sri Lankan mascot, who came into the stand, accompanied by a small band.  He was excellent, especially considering the heat and how hot he must of been in that suit. I left after ten overs ...... no atmosphere, England hopeless, rotten beer and the final straw the "Giv us a wave, water boy," directed at Eoin Morgan, who was not playing, but giving a drink, to a teammate on the boundary.
Better if the management could focus on the cleanliness around the ground as people sometimes tend to get very uncomfortable because of this

As a boy I watched the legends of Sri Lankan cricket, so it was a dream come true to see Sri Lanka play on their home turf against England and bring back some of those historic fireworks. Cheering amongst young and old to the beat of drums and choirs of school students really brought the stadium to life.

‚Ä™ ‚Ä™We visited the R Premadasa stadium on the 23rd October 2018. We were very appalled by the state of the ladies toilets, not cleaned for some time, excrement everywhere, no toilet paper, no soap. Many women and children now attend matches and would expect at least some effort would have been made at an international fixture. If Sri Lanka really have aspirations to welcome the cricketing world to your country and it‚Äôs national stadium then this is not a good advert especially compared to facilities we experienced at Kandy.‚Ä¨

R. Premadasa Stadium is a very important landmark in Colombo! Being a huge cricket fan, I had to make sure that I visit the ground where there have been many epic cricket matches. The stadium is not the best in the world, but it was still beautiful to be here. The best bit for me is to visit the various cafe's around and to see cricket memorabilia. Only for cricket lovers this place!
Onem of the most famous cricket ground in Sri Lanka. It's So close to Colombo and International Airport. So it's best place to watch cricket match live. But around the ground is always busy.

It was surprising that common visitors like us can enter into this famous stadium just to have a look around. It was more surprising to see some young boys relaxing there after their school exams. Felt nice to see around this famous stadium. Ganesh J
The most iconic crockery stadium of Sri Lanka. This one has witnessed many great and historic matches and must visit for a cricket fan.
Most iconic cricket stadium in Sri Lanka. Must visit if you are a cricket lover. A beautiful ground which hostedany great matches.
We enjoyed cricket tournaments well in this cricket ground.  Day night matches are pretty interesting

We booked our tickets on line when we arrived in Colombo for the Sri Lanka v South Africa T20 on Tuesday 14th Aug as a birthday treat for my partner. We booked premier seats in the grand stand and looked forward to a great evening out for the family. We eventually got to our allotted seats and someone was sat in them. We were told by a young Male that the seats were taken and tried to move us on.  Clearly we refused and stayed in our seats. What transpired thereafter was a shambles. In a nutshell we discovered that the 5 row of seats in front of us including ours had been pre-purchased or bought fraudulently for a crowd of rowdy young males who had clearly purchased tickets underhand. Several families turned up claiming their spaces but were ushered away by the young men. We saw the young men taking off seat numbers to disguise the seats. There was no order and as the match proceeded the young men became more rowdy drinking alcohol from large water bottles full of alcohol. It became quite stressful for us as we could no longer see the match and were completely intimidated. We tried to seek assistance from officials and the police but absolutely no one remotely cared. In the end we left the event early to avoid the huge crowds leaving the stadium as we realised the exits would be equally unsafe. Such a shame as the atmosphere in the stadium itself was exciting but massively spoilt by unruly and disrespectful spectators. A very disappointing evening in the end.

Friendly locals who evidently love cricket spill into the stadium and fill it up into an excited, bubbling pot of enthusiasm as each wicket is taken. Yes, the entrance of spectators isn‚Äôt managed regimentally but not once will you feel unsafe. The local residents add to the occasion by offering face paints and selling Sri Lanka stickers and flags. A happy ending too with Sri Lanka beating South Africa in T20. Enjoy!
A typical example of how money earned is mismanaged,the toilets are probably the filthiest toilets you would find at any international sporting venue,and even most other facilities were below par!

Amazing cricket ground. Located in Colombo 10. R.Premadasa stadium known as Keththarama stadium. For many decades this was only day and night ground in Sri Lanka. Watched many international matches in this ground and most occasion witnessed Sri Lankan team win.If your true cricket fan you mus visit Premadasa stadium.
High standard of refurbishment done by Jehovah's witnesses for their Convention there.  From derelict facility to beautifully clean Stadium.  The City can be proud of this facility
very good result whn watchign the cricket here so many people can gather here for nay local match too and many tiem have plenty concerts mainly south indian singers mostly have big big conzert
I would like to tell everyone this is the grate place i have ever visited in my life.Place located in grater colombo area.
I have been visited few times this stadium to watch cricket matches held by ICC. it is a nice place to enjoy

You can enjoy the true spirit of Sri Lankan Cricket at this place. The environment is truly awesome. Better if you can go with a friends. Whether you are a cricket fan or not, you must watch match at this place within your lifetime. During matches there are beer stalls around the stadium where you can get a beer glass for around 1$. Also there are local  sellers who sells sweet items who will come near your seats. Entering and leaving the place is bit hard when there is lot of crowd.
I went with family for the India Sri Lanka Match. Nice atmosphere and good crowd to watch with. You get food and drinks too for purchase. View is good from Grand stand
Watching cricket for the first with all my colleague cheering for India Team is a very nice experience.  Nice stadium.
Had an opportunity a great match between Sri Lanka and Bangladesh. The ambiance was superb. People around are very friendly. I would love to again see a match from this stadium.
Went there for the 20/20 between India and Sri Lanka. The atmosphere was simply electric. Very large. Clean. Impressive. I wish the infrastructure around was a bit better though.

Was here for india sri lanka cricket match, bot odi and t20. The stadium is big and ample facilities. There are a lot of food options during the match breaks. The staff were helpful. Will visit again!
Well, this cricket ground is good for cricket lovers. If you want to see match with big crowd, this is the place

R. Premadasa International Cricket Stadium, popularly known as the Premadasa Stadium is a cricket stadium on Khettarama Road in Colombo. This Cricket ground is one of the iconic places in Sri Lanka for Cricket lovers. It is the largest stadium in Sri Lanka with its capacity of 35,000 spectators. You may visit the stadium if you are in Colombo and of course, if you are a cricket lover.
The Premadasa stadium, named after a former President of Sri Lanka, is a great place to enjoy cricket both by day and night. It has the biggest lights in Sri Lanka so ideal for the latter.
In Sri Lanka one of the large stadium with biggest lights, suggest you all to go there at least for a match specially night ODI and T20.
Bigger than SSC Colombo, I'm here for work. No restaurants or bar in stadium. They sell some food and beer at match time.

Stadium location is hidden from the main city..you have to find those narrow streets to pass by.. the allocated seats for us in the upper view in the row A is broken.. I found most of the plastic seats were broken..in the lower view some of the seats not available, in that police were sitting with some plastic chairs tied up with ropes..üòåüòå Need to improve a lot, in facilitating the viewers..

If you want to watch an India match, go to colombo ;) There is no hassle to find parking, plenty of vehicles to take you around, no pushing/jostling to get inside, carry your own food/drinks if you need to, carry your laptop bag and even get beer to buy inside and carry it to your seat! Sounds like a dream for an Indian fan? I enjoyed it here!!

Went to witness Sri Lanka Vs India 5th ODI. The seats were unclean. Most importantly being a match against India and my nephew being a vegetarian, I was surprised that there were no food stalls selling  veg food. There were only a couple of food stalls in the so-called Grand Stand and  the variety was useless. All in all, I was very disappointed.
This is a place of happiness and entertainment of world of Cricket in Sri Lanka. Lovely place for all Cricket fans.

We have been there number of times when the home team was playing cricket. Wonderful place great scene under flood lights at night. Gets heavily crowded and noisy. Parking is limited, so better to avoid personal transportation. Since the place was renovated for the world cup 2015, facilities are good. Only problem is the way to the stadium lies along highly populated area (small,  packed houses with narrow roads), which will be odd for a first timer, but nothing to worry about.

This is one of the iconic place in Sri Lanka for Cricket lovers. Ex President, Premadasa memorial Stadium located in the middle of the city in Colombo. Fully crowded if there is a match but better to have a look for few hours in case if you are in Colombo.

R. Premadasa Stadium was originated by the late president Premadasa. It is in the heart of  Colombo and was built on a marshy land. It is one of the biggest Cricket grounds and main venue in Sri Lanka. It has flood lights and cricket matches are played as day and night  also. There are 40,000 seats in the esplanade for watching cricket matches being played. Massive crowd gather here for Sri Lanka cricket matches and become noisy. Sri Lanka crowd accept losses also even-though they expect a win. The crowd do not stone houses of the players if a match is lost. If you need better facilities, buy a ticket for Grand Stand. You can mingle with the Sri Lankan spectators if you go there during a cricket match.

Went there when there as no match. ALthough visitors are not permistted in the stadium durin nin match days the staff were extremely kind to let us in. A great modern stadium located in Khettarama - 3km from Messenger street. Its pretty hot though - I recommend sunglasses, cap and lots of water/gatorade!
This is one of our best and largest grounds, hence most of the International Cricket Matches are played at this venue. As an Annoincer for SL Cricket I have visited this place so many times.
we went for our life's first ever cricket match. Srilanka vs Bangaladesh. Amazing Crowd and Lovely Fans. What a game. I'll visti again when i come to Lanka again.

I enjoyed a fantastic night of t20 cricket at the Premadasa watching Sri Lanka vs Bangladesh. We opted for tickets in the grandstand (4000 rupees each). However, tickets begin at 300 rupees. Snacks and drinks are readily available within the ground. One word of warning - it takes some time to reach the ground from central Colombo locations, leave plenty of time in order to reach the ground on time.
Premadasa stadium is a nice place in colombo and a landmark. The place is clean and well maintained just like the Galle stadium.

This is one of the best cricket stadiums in the country. Also R. Premadasa ground also known as Qeththarama ground is the most sought after venue for day and night cricket matches. Ground is well maintained and also the pavilions are quite good compared to SSC grounds. Normally ODIs and T20s are played in this venue. Since the ground is situated in an urban area, parking might be a bit of a problem. It's quite easy to park your vehicle a little bit further from the ground and come to the ground by a 3-wheeler.

it is very difficult to get to the stadium on time, thru traffic & condition of the road.  anyway, we in sri lanka feel that ROAD DEVELOPMENT & TRANSPORT are 2 very sore points that prompt some youngsters who cannot see a career in cricket, leave our island to greener pastures across the seas.

Well if you are a cricket fan it makes sense to visit this. Unless there is a match there is no point visiting the place. I wish there were more & better toilets as well as less police presence during matches.
this is one of the best cricket grounds in srilanka. easily accessable and it is like a festivel when there is a match going.
R premadasa stadium was nice place . We went see the cricket match. It was amezing with the peoples noisy. Lovely place

The Stadium is situated in the busy city of Colombo. Cricket fans around Srilanka could easily reach the stadium by public transport services. Shanty houses can be seen in the surrounding, therefore safe vehicle parking is major issue for spectators. I suggest the spectators to use public transport services or taxis.
This is one of the biggest stadium in the region, it best to see cricket match where you can see the local support for the sport its a amazing feeling

one of the biggest cricket venues in Sri Lanka. This includes a grandstand if you can buy tickets in time. It is a shrine for cricket loving Sri Lankans. It is in Colombo. You can reach to the grounds in few minutes from many of the famous hotels in Colombo. When the lights are switched on in day / night matches it gives a spectacular view of the ground
When there is no match you can only see it from outside. This is considered cricketer's paradise in Lanka. Every budding cricketer dreams of playing on this ground!
R. Premadasa Stadium most popular cricket ground in sri lanka. during national cricket matches it has an amazing crowd and gets really noisy

We had managed to get tickets to the last game of the Australia tour of Sri Lanka at the R.Premadasa Stadium in Khettarama, Colombo. We were advised to arrive early. With the game scheduled to start at 7pm we made arrangements to leave our hotel around 4pm. The drive to the access road took around 15 mins after which we realised that the access roads were in fact closed. Our guide managed to turn the car around and find a parking lot really close by which costs around 250lkr for the evening. Apparently its arranged by the municipality but by the looks of it , was some random arrangement that was made between the cops and the shop owners. In any event, we took the walk down a narrow access road towards the stadium. We arrived on Maligawatta lane and made our way to the gates. And then up and up and up again to our seats. The stands are quite steep with large stairs and this may make it difficult if going with kids as we discovered. Word of advice, there are a few small stores opposite the entrances in Maligawatta Lane. Buy snacks before you go in. In many parts of the stadium the food vendors just simply do not go to. The elevated sections seem to be particularly ignored by them possibly due to the work required to get up and down and then still negotiate a pack stand with a crazy incline. During the international games it seems there is a huge police presence which means very few if any access controls are bypassed. Unlike the game in Pallekelle our area was limited to ticket holders with the correct access , and personally saw them turning away people with differnet areas marked on their tickets. The visibility all round this stadium is great. Noise levels are as expected although the addition of a band with steel instruments was at times a bit louder than it needed to be. Overall we had a great evening out. We witnessed a collapse and a comeback in the game and ultimately Australia walked out deserved winners after a big scare. Was also T.M. Dilshan's last international game so was great to see that first hand at a ground that has so much of history to Sri Lankan cricket. Next stop the SSC Colombo...
We visited to watch SL v Aus ODI. The stewards were excellent and we had a good match and entertainment. Food and drink is available.

Recently saw 2 one dayers Sri Lanka V's Australia.  Lots of security checks to get in, though didn't take too long  ( which was a good thing). 1st game was in the old stand , toilets down stairs were disgusting by end of the game. Only a very small booth at bottom and behind grandstand to buy beer and food, 10 ppl deep everybody pushing in squeezing past,. Atmosphere is stand was great with the locals.  the 2nd game was in the newer stand , so much better to buy food and drinks, a lot more civilised no crowds pushing & toilets much cleaner.
Been there for cricket matches and it looks average. But the only dislike is the alley that we have to walk through to get into the stadium

It was my first visit to an International match since discovering a love of the only sport there is, cricket Sadly Sri Lanka lost Don't even consider getting there in a car, go by taxi or tuk tuk, even then it's a fair walk to the entrance as most roads are closed off by the police. Great atmosphere, food and drink available at not too exagerated prices. Drinks vendors also wander around during the match, so you don't have to miss any of the cricket.. If goind, get tickets in advance, and aim for stand B, we had the top tier, and this gives a really good view over the whole ground

Good place to watch . Got grand seat . Decent crowd . Parking is crazy . Had to park 10 min away from the stadium .very clean washrooms , no veg snacks available. Only kfc chicken & hot dog no fries, alcohol and soft drinks are there . Decent prices
The venue spells cricket!! Finding a place to park is next to impossible. Located in the heart of Colombo. Caution advised. Washrooms are horrible.
I went there to watch a cricket match. Stadium is nice and give good view. Entrance had very big queue.
Good Ground,But the area which is located is not much good for in the evening. Be careful.Day time is OK
If u are a cricket lover u cannot say no to this place. Its a place to die for with the view and the stands

The stadium is an International venue for Cricket , for day and Night matches . Located quite centrally in Colombo with a large seating capacity . A brain child of the illustrious President of Sri Lanka late Ransinghe Premadasa . A popular venue for cricket .
I have been here many times. A good place to watch the Gentlemen's game called Cricket. Wash rooms are utterly unclean. No proper management on this area. Other than that, everything is fine here...

R. Premadasa AKA Keththarama stadium is the second biggest cricket ground in Sri Lanka. It was established in 1986 as Keththarama Stadium and after the death of Late President Ranasinghe Premadasa  the founder of the stadium, in 1994, the stadium renamed as R. Premadasa Stadium. Stadium is located in Maligawatta, Colombo 08 and the best way to come there is by using the Baseline road and get a tuk tuk (nearly 150-200 lkr). Other than that it is easier to come from Maradana, Panchikawatte junction and get a tuk tuk(nearly 150-200 lkr). There are no direct bus route to come to the ground. The ground has 5 seating areas named as Grand Stand, Block A-D. All the stands have upper tier and lower tier seating. If you want to get the best view of the play, my suggestion is right hand corners of upper tiers of Block C and Block B and left hand corners of the upper tiers of Block A and Block D. Those areas gives you the real cricket feeling (like watching it on TV). The Grand Stand is good but it costs much. The experience you can get from the ground is amazing. There will be almost 35K crowd for a match when Sri Lanka is playing. The crowd is electrified and you can hear all kind of Papare music and DJs too. Lot of dancing, singing and other party related things happening during the cricket match. There are some food outlets and beer stalls there but the prices are bit high from the standard prices. You can get food and beverages from the out side of the ground but not liquor. Beer is the only thing you can get but again no out side beer. There are many public toilets for both men and women and the condition is quite good. This is the best place to get the cricket fun in Sri Lanka. Be there and feel it.

Being indian cricket is in our genes. I have seen many of srilankan matches on TV and been hearing about this place for almost decade. First thing i have done is to visit this place and to live glory on my own.

I am lucky to see this stadium . When I was entry this stadium . Police was stop my car . I am requesting that police to entry and see the stadium. Police was agree and I see the stadium . And remember disilva .
i was lucky to get in. it is a huge stadium. i liked the lush green field. the gallery is huge and colourful
It's near by the Colombo City Limits and very beautiful ground and lot of space(Capacity) for spectators to watch the matches. It's better place for cricket lovers.

Ground is huge but relatively small comparing to Hambantota Sooriyawewa stadium. This place has produced lots of great matches and able to see energetic and electrified crowd in the stadium, especially locals.

Cricket is the best possible way to make the islanders with billions of differences to bring in to a same stage. And the to get the best of it you should go to watch a IOD match at R. Premadasa or known as the Keththarama. Situated in the middle of the packed shanties Premadasa is the most vibrant ground with it's 40000 plus capacity and music and fun loving cricket fans in the country. On a day of a cricket match street food venders, tatoo masters, flag sellers and body painters take control of the pavements in the area which gives a quite ceremonial context. it is easy to get a transport to the ground and after any where when the match ends. only thing is you may have to pay around double at night. but nothing takes away the enthusiasm it creates in the hearts of the cricket fans.

Sri Lanka vs England last 50 over Dec 2014. We had a fantastic time. It was however Sanga & Mahela's last 50 over match in Sri Lankan soil. There were hundreds of papapre bands around the ground. I will try and upload the video. great place to watch crc
Best feeling to visit that ground as I'm Indian cricket fan good place good food enjoyed al lot at night time
Was a nice experience for a cricket lover like me to visit this stadium. The stadium was empty as there was no match being played, so gave us an opportunity to click few pictures in the stands ;-)
Great Location. Easy to access. the facilities should be more improved. The Ideal place to watch cricket.

This was purposely built by one of the late Presidents of Sri Lanka for cricket in 1986. This international venue holds the highest test cricket world record score of 952 against Sri Lanka against India. Away from busy CBD commotion.

If you want to see cricket being followed passionately with fun Premadasa is the place to be. Here you will find how Sri Lankans enjoy their cricket. The "papare" bands played continuously, and people dancing in the isles and on their seats and pretty much having a pretty good time... and the best part,.. unlike their bigger neighbours Sri Lankan fans will not get too upset by their team losing. The music will continue and the dancing will continue. They love their team to win, but having fun is higher priority... The facilities at the Premadasa are not the best. Getting to the ground can be a bit tough. For anyone looking to experience the Sri Lankan way of watching and enjoying cricket, I would highly recommend the A upper and B upper stands..
Lovely stadium with a great location. We did not manage to catch an actual match, but certainly on a match day we could imagine the lively atmosphere.

I imagined that the Cricket Loving Public would enjoy their Cricket but no idea about their Enthusiasm inspire of torrential rain during the ODI i went to watch versus the West Indies.The rain in any other country i have watched Cricket in would have put an instant Stop to proceedings and it was simply extraordinary to witness the efforts of Local Manpower to ensure that this Game was played if at all possible.And it was,eventually after 2 or 3 hour of on and off rain and i mean RAIN.The Groundstaff(nee ARMY) uncovered the Ground one last time(that is the whole ground!)and enabling the game to be concluded.And what a game it was.reduced to 26 overs per side the West Indies managed to post a reasonable total inspire of their disadvantage batting first.The Sri Lankan's set about the Modest Total in One day terms with relish but were eventually pegged back and it required a last gasp Free Hit Six to enable the closest of home Victory's.The ensuing excitement and celebrations were irresistible and i found myself dancing with delight along with the Local supporters.Few what a night to remember at the Premadasa Stadium,perfect for One day international Cricket.
Good seats. Crappy sarounding area. Awesome atmosphere Average food stalls Allows paper bands Nice view
We go there to see the tests cricket match between india and srilanka. Nice stadium. Amd there india won the match. Also i meet #shudhir there.
It is was my dream to watch a Srilankan Cricket match in Srilanka, finally this ground paved me to fulfill my desire with great enjoyment with Srilankan spectators...it was noisy.. but I enjoyed it

The stadium is the brainchild of the late Sri Lankan president Ranasinghe Premadasa, who championed the development of this 40,000-seater concrete bowl, the biggest stadium in Sri Lanka. Opened on 2 February 1986 with a match between a Sri Lanka 'B' side and an England 'B' team, the stadium was built on swampland previously used by monks ferrying across to the Khettarama temple adjacent to it. If you are a Cricket lover, Must watch a match in R. Premadasa. Electrifying stadium around the world. Recommended to book a ticket at Grand Stand to have more fun.
Do you love Cricket? Never miss a match day on R. Premadasa. Electrifying stadium around the world. Book a ticket at Grand Stand
Good place to c stadium during the matches . If test or one day matches are going it's nearby to visit . Great place to visit . Intl matches .
Beautifully manicured lawns and bang in the center of the city.The open nature of the stadium allows passerby to watch the actions in the stadium.
it was totally empty but looking very nice and beautiful.. enjoyed clicking the pictures at will and without any hassels..
beautiful place not to miss. had lunch with friends in the restaurant. it also has a fish aquarium built on the ground covered with glass. you can walk on the glass. children would enjoy this

T20 vs Pakistan was fantastic. Corporate box seats for under $10 and atmosphere was electric. No booze in the stands was a surprise as was being sent back and forth by well meaning staff who had no idea where the corporate boxes were, but did nothinng to dampen the experience.
Great place to watch matches ... not the cleanest washrooms and the parking is not safe either. watch out for your stuff and come prepared for high temperatures .

Was really expecting an electric atmosphere. However, at the ODI a few days earlier there was a riot. As a consequence there was a massive police and army presence. I think this put off a lot of locals from coming. I could see that from what atmosphere there was it would be really good with a full stadium (or even half full!). I would  recommend getting seats in a corporate box. We booked seats in box A15 online (the website looked really suspect, but it was legit). It had a room with glass walls that was air conditioned, a TV to watch the game on (useful for replays), and an outdoor balcony to get closer to the action. Half a pint of beer was Rs150 and a hot dog was about Rs120.
Good one. Well maintained. Understand that only few cricketers are statying in Colombo.Its always better to go during he match,
The largest cricket stadium in Sri Lanka with floodlights. It is always fully packed whenever Sri Lanka plays.

The Biggest cricket Stadium in Srilanka Which has host all major tournaments in Cricket World including T20 world cup final which was held in 2012. The stadium is located in Colombo - 10 which is easy accessible via taxi, tuk tuk etc.. The Stadium was recently renovated with great seating and other facilities.
I liked the grandeur and the architecture of the Stadium. Would be lovely to witness when some matches or performances are going on.

This stadium was fantastic the seating is done great.The atmosphere was out of this world. Music,cheering and singing.If you want to go and see a game where everyone is passionate about sport this is the place to go and watch it. CHEAP BEER :)
This in fact is the only stadium in Colombo they have D/N matches. Stadium is one of the best in Sri Lanka. But accessibility and parking is one of the biggest issues

I was there couple of times while working as a journalist to cover several matches, and the most unforgettable experience was at the ICC T20 WC held in Sri Lanka and I got the chance to visit their several times ... ground was packed and it was all exciting .. I wonder how they fit in so many people to this venue .. ground quality is good though there are room for some improvements ... but I think its one of the best venues for Cricket in the world !!!

I've watched over 10 matches (ODI & Test) in this ground and the only sections i haven't tried yet are corporate boxes. View from each section is perfect, despite of whether you are on upper or lower.. But my personal favorites are A and B.. Grand stand gives you the perfect-straight cut view and believe me, the ticket worth it all.. but i prefer a little more angular view :) Food choices normally be hotdogs, pork chops, rolls, french fries and drumsticks. ice cream and beverages would be beer, ice tea, redbull, and other soft drinks (pepsi, mirinda etc). But you can always buy some wade and packed food like biscuits, tipitip  sort from near by shops, but i highly advise to STAY AWAY FROM some STREET FOOD! (sorta have few bad memories :P ) Always had the best live match memories in this stadium and it all so much fun!

In True sense... you feel like you are in a country who Lives Cricket, Drinks Cricket, Eats cricket and also sleeps with Cricket. Nice Stadium. Good International Finish and Looks, Overall a Pleasant Experience

I had been to the premadasa stadium during the icc T20 cricket world cup matches. It's a good stadium with really good seating arrangements. It's a perfect venue for international cricket matches! They've done a good job with the floodlights!

This stadium is used for all Sri Lanka ODI's. Access to all facilities inside the ground is quite good. The problem is getting in in the first place. The area is absolutely teeming with the locals. If you get lost trying to get to your particular area there are plenty of people willing to help you.

This is the only international cricket stadium of colombo,one must visit who are cricket lovers ! Most of the international cricket matches including of cricket world cup are played here ! so one must visit this stadium

So nice to visit this place and allowed to be in even without any matches. My boy was so eager to be there and we attempt to get in and succeded. Huge and well maintained statdium - though I didn't like the surrounding settlements outside the stadium area. It was so narrow roads, people playing and crowdy settelment, which I find is an obstacle for people movement in and out of stadium, especially with vehicles.
Easy to get to by tuk tuk but expect to pay more going back after a match! Nice ground and got to watch the cricket despite rain early on

Good atmosphere, poor refreshments on offer. Could have felt intimidated by the surrounding area and the majority of spectators were Sri Lankan but they were all very friendly. Plenty of tuk tuks available to get away after the game

We went to the odi game last night (dead rubber) the atmosphere is great the sheer noise of the crowds is just fantastic. We splurged and brought tickets(online in sydney) in the A23 upper corporate box which has airconditioned indoor area (with tv 15sec delayed broadcast) and an open air balcony. You may want to get there early to get the outdoor seats, we asked  to move to the adjacent boxes A21 which is the view of the pitch (at a slight angle) I prefer. The attendant was very helpful and obliged and also checked a couple of times during the day/night to ensure we were happy. would recommend to see a game here. I would suggest that you bring your own lunch with you as I could not find  much variety in food nearby. That said the beer is around $2 and Keells hotdog $1.25 which is good value

It's a big stadium, but the stairs in places are shockingly bad. The authorities allow people to sit/stand in the aisles, which is dangerous. The seats aren't very comfortable, and the toilets are pretty uninviting. That said Lion beer was only 200 rupees and I recommend the fresh pineapple sellers who come round selling half a pineapple for 100 rupees.
Had 2 brilliant days watching the cricket. The atmosphere was great, even though England lost both the games we went to.

Watched the first two matches v England. Friendly helpful staff .Brilliant sri lanka supporters ¬£10 a ticket for the upper level were not ripped off for food/drink.just a shame we could only be there for those two matches

I would say, this is one of the greatest and loveliest ground all over the world which could accommodate nearly 40,000 spectators. It's situated just within the heart of Colombo. To talk about the ground, it's filled with seats with small gaps in between for the air and the newly built stands for the 2011 WorldCup enlightens the ground even more. The heartwarming scene would be during a Day-Night match, you could see the sun setting behind the stadium as the lights comes on to the play which would be so beautiful for a snap.

A good cricket ground and the standards have been increased after 2011. A beautiful stadium in the middle of Colombo. Except the roads and traffic getting there everything else is perfect. Only thing that is missing is a swimming pool.
This is the Best Cricket Ground in Sri Lanka. Pitches are excellent to derive a result. Ground facilities such as toilet can be improved. Only problem here is parking.

When a big game happens parking is a mess, better come in a tuk tuk and return same way don't bring your car, Average facilities but cant complain, Very congested area with a lot of street hawkers particularly when matches are being played, Capacity 60 thousand spectators, Can play day night matches, Good covering in all areas to stay away from the sun, well if it rains it does not help the game, entrance tickets change from time to time as per Cricket board decisions.

This is the place to watch Srilanka play cricket.The place will be full with people and noise.If you are a cricket fan or not and in Srilanka when the local team is playing you must come enjoy the match and have some fun.

Premadasa Stadium is a historic place for all the subcontinent cricket lovers. This is where Murali unveiled his magic for years. They have a small galleria for history lover, and the cafe is very famous as it is frequented by Big guns of Srilankan cricket, current and former. It's an awesome place to be just to get the feel of all those epic moments on the ground, although ground itself is not in such a good condition.

R. Premadasa Stadium is an amazing place, if you love cricket like I do, then this place is a must visit during your visit to Sri Lanka. The atmosphere in this ground is electric and you too will end up screaming, shouting and dancing along with the crowd!

Watched south Africa smash the sri Lankans but the atmosphere was awesome. With thousands of dancing chanting locals supporting their stars it was a fantastic experience. Don't buy the cheap seats at 100R. Go for at least 500R. Also make sure to sit on the western side. The sun blasts into the eastern stands all afternoon...

We visied when,Sri Lanka had just been crowned the World T20 cricket champs after winning their finals against India at Dhaka, Bangladesh. The upkeep and maintenance of the ground is with the Srl Lankan Airforce, who are doing a commendable job. The playing area is lush green and the stadium chairs are brght yellow and grey all numbered, the scoreboard is manual, could not notice any electronic scoreboard.The commentary and press box is glass covered and air conditioned. Premadasa hosts ODIs and T20 cricket matches.A proud possession for a proud cricketing nation.
Well,There was no match going on,but still I insisted to visit the stadium.Its worth a visit only if u have some cricket mania.Clean and well maintained.
Looks very simple, unlike other stadiums in India or UK. From outside you can see whats happening inside, no barriers as in other stadiums.
Watched the 2011 WC match between Pak and SL and the atmosphere was just awesome. SL crowds are the most well behaved and fun loving too in Asia and it makes for a pleasant experience.

I have been to R. Premadasa stadium a few times to watch international cricket matches. Last time was during the South Africa tour to Sri Lanka. Ground is large and has the capacity for a crowd over 30,000. Good view can be expected from Grand Stand, A Upper, B Upper blocks as well as C and D Upper Blocks. A Lower and B lower will give you close action to the stadium. C and D lower blocks will not have seats and just the concrete seating with no back rest which is not comfortable. Always make sure you go to the grounds well in advance if it is an International cricket match with Sri Lanka as it can be a huge crowd and getting in to the ground can be a nightmare. Last time we had a terrible time getting in as we were late. If you drive to the place, parking can be difficult as well. Unless you go very early you will not be able to park in official park. You can park close to grounds in the roads of Maligawatta. However beware that the residents will collect money from you for parking (about 300Rs) and do not try to argue with them as the neighborhood is not friendly. My advise is to take a tuk-tuk or taxi if possible. During a cricket match, food, drinks and beer stalls will be available in all stands also the music. If you know what cricket is, this is a must see place during a cricket match as the atmosphere will be really festive.

we went hoping to have a look inside.  when we got there there the B&q team were playing they let us in to have a look with a security man, we watched for a couple of minutes then left, worth a visit for any cricket fan

International Matches in Colombo are held here. The atmosphere at the grounds is electric, with many papare bands playing. Would recommend all cricket fans to go at least once and experience a match at the R. Premadasa Stadium. Negatives Not a place to visit families. Beer is freely available and generally towards the end most ppl are drunk, with the odd fight expected.

This is a nice Stadium in Colombo. Can enjoy cricket as you wish. This is close to the Colombo city and nice big ground. Can easily find and go by taxi. The road to stadium is rather dirty but stadium is quite nice.

Watching cricket in Sri Lanka a must do! Locals passionate about game and so friendly! Good availability of beers, drinks and snacks access to stadium a little daunting but taxi drivers know the drill! Security, seating, exits etc all very good and well managed

This is one of the international grounds in Colombo, hope many may not know Colombo is only city has 4 international cricket grounds, this stadium is recently renovated and it has more comfortable seats and access roads. It is situated at Maligawatte Colombo 10. it can be reached by public transport. All most all day and night international cricket matches will held here. It will not be very safe for single female to go alone be watchfull.

Went there to watch Sri Lanka make mincemeat of South Africa in the one day international.  It is not situated in a particularly affluent area and leaving the ground might perturb anyone leaving after dark.  Be aware of the Tuk Tuk drivers who take advantage of that and quote ridiculous prices to get you out of there.  The one we had told us it would take us an hour to get home and cost us 1,000 rupees.  It had taken us 20 mins to get there and cost 300.  When I showed him the route on Google Maps, he got angry and so we stopped the vehicle and sent him on his way.  Have that App handy- it's a traveller's friend. All that aside, tickets to matches are cheap and there is good quality seating available.  The views that the Grandstand gives are well worth paying a little more for.

We went to a 20/20 match between Sri Lanka and South Africa.  Great match and what a noise from the sell out crowd.  We had numbered seats but evidently no one takes any notice of that.  We paid 750 rupees per seat for a great view from the grandstand.  Easy to buy drinks.  We had booked a taxi for after the match which was just as well as in the crowds, in the dark, it would be quite easy to get lost.

This is like my second home! Coming here always gives me a reason to come back whether we win or lose, just cos of the superb atmosphere. Thanks to online bookings and seat reservation, we dont have to worry about getting horrible seats. Few things they could improve: stop selling liquor - have witnessed many fights between drunk men and women make the prices cheaper - Rs. 200 for a hot dog is retrocious have greater parking capacity - currently you need a car pass to park the vehicles, it would be better if they'd use the already available space to park more cars, or have another car park some where near the main road, and allow taxis to come right up to the grounds Once I was about to die of suffocation (England india T20) cos there were so many people pushing in the queue. It would be good if the authorities would streamline this process to avoid queues to enter. Amongst all the bad experiences and the losses SL has faced in this ground, it is still my favourite cricket related place on earth! I danced face to face with  Chris Gayle here for Gangnam style! One of the best places on earth for a cricket lover!! Superb atmosphere! #ILuvSL
Watched a couple of cricket matches there... Beer, hot dogs, cheap seats - what more do you need! Tuk tuks everywhere...

The mecca of Sri Lankan cricket - a must visit for cricket fans. A beautiful stadium in the centre of Colombo. Only the second cricket ground in the world to have floodlights for day-night matches. Recently rebuilt. Excellent stands with good seating - both the grandstand and the other blocks. You won't find a better atmosphere anywhere in the cricketing world - the local 'papare' bands play throughout the match (no matter who's winning); deejay music; crowds cheering without a break the entire game; food vendors bring drinks, hot dogs, etc to your seat; half-time shows... Crowd control is amazingly excellent. You can take your wife and kids and enjoy the game. Everyone is body-checked at the entrance, and prohibited items are politely confiscated - including liquor. Different blocks are segregated very well with fences, so no-one can get unruly. The crowd can't rush on to the field either as there's a fence, so the cricketers are quite safe, unlike in many grounds in India, England, etc. In any case, Sri Lankan cricket fans love to enjoy their cricket, and never seem to get unruly. Toilet facilities are reasonable (better than most grounds in the Subcontinent).
After the renovations the place is good for a game and the seating area is widely modified. Rest rooms and food stales is less for a huge crowed.

wow!! must visit for all cricket buffs so you can enjoy a cricket match better when you watch it on tv. request permission to go inside the stadium and the security officer there is more than happy to guide you. must visit for cricket buffs though at the end of the day all stadii looks the same :D:D
A famous stadium among the Sri Lankans and for Cricket. A large gathering can be accommodated at a time and conveniently located with good parking.

One of Sri Lanka's largest cricket stadiums, The R Premadasa when full with a tight match is a roller coaster ride of emotional highs and lows. From dead silence to when a local wicket falls to the deafening roar of a six being hit. It has decent facilities with mostly pop-up eateries. The VIP section has a buffet and a chance to mix a few cricket stars once in a while! Parking is a chore. You may need to park around 1km away and walk unless your a VIP. If your a foreigner and you have never been to a cricket match in Asia then your missing out!

Premdasa stadium is Only stadium of Colombo who has witnessed lots of events Of Cricket. Its a huge one that will satisfy your visit.It has hosted T20 world cup and the love for the cricket of Sri Lankans can be easily felt  by visit
As a cricket lover, if you are in Colombo you must visit this beautiful stadium with lush green grass. Just a fantastic ground. Right in the middle of Colombo and easily accessible.
It was my first ever live cricket match. enjoyed very much. It would've been great if the SL cricket team won the T20 finals. unless a great spot to enjoy a World cup finale.

I was really lucky to see the semi finals  in T20 World cup tournament 2012 and I would really like to say I am really proud how they organized this world cup here in R. Premadasa Stadium. All the modern facilities are available here. Stunning view, A great great place for cricket lovers to enjoy the game.
This is renewed cricket ground where you can watch cricket match very freely. Also this is in Colombo and anyone can reach here without any hassle.
I have been to a match in T20 Worldcup tournament 2012 and I am very much impressed with the way they have organized such a large crowd
oh my ! traveling from India it was a heaven watching a match there. Absolute joyous crowd, alcohol served in the stadium for all ticket holders, and so is kfc , pizza hut
The best place to watch a great game of cricket! Situated area is not that great, but the stadium is awsome!
This is the premier cricket stadium in Sri Lanka.  It is set in a less beautiful suburb of Colombo and visitors may be disappointed with the surroundings but the stadium itself is worth a visit.
good viewing stadium, but the neighbourhood isnt great and dont eat the food! couldnt find any toilets in the stadium either!

This is one of the famous cricket grounds where most of the international cricket matches are played when ever the game takes place within the city of Colombo. The stadium could take few thousands of cricket fans during cricket matches and situated in the heart of the city.
The palce is packed for big games. Wash room facilities are perhapse less than adequate. The road leading upto the stadium is not that great.
The ground is the second highest played odi matches in the world, beautiful view, excellent ground staff, and the score is also good

Poor facilities, pain to get to and from, especially when busy. Plenty of security staff who did absolutely nothing. Very inconsistent when searching visitors to the stadium, and allowing people to enter without tickets

There was nothing to dislike about this stadium. Everywhere you sat you had a fantastic view. Amazing carnival atomosphere and contagious excitement all around. If you're western be prepared to have some kids ask you for a ticket. Very non-threatening environment, very helpful staff and a fantastic experience. My everyday ground for watching cricket is the MCG in Melbourne. If you're expecting this to be the MCG of Sri Lanka in terms of facilities and quality, you're not going to enjoy it. Just be sure to take it for what it is and remember where you are, because the atomosphere I experienced throughout the T20 World Cup was better then any I've had in Australia and before you know it those things you've forgotten about where you are. Loved my time here.
Worthy of watching a cricket match.  Great atmosphere with WI vs Aus.  Not to far from the city.  But def worth watching a game in one of SL major stadiums
A great day at the England V India t20 match. Great views,  whenever there is a captive audienceGreat venue to watch cricket, electric atmosphere, you'll love it.

Enjoyed all games from Super Eight till Semi-finals! View from Grand stand is just amazing and even the normal stands are not bad. The crowd was buzzing and security guards were fully alert. A great great place for cricket lovers to enjoy the game.

Went to watch the Twenty20 cricket. Aus v Pak and RSA vs Ind. Electric atmosphere at the ground. Especially for the last match that started in the early evening. Security is incredibly tight which is a positive - just expect a bit of a wait if you turn up at peak time for security screening. We had tickets for the Grandstand - category 1 tickets which only cost about USD18 each. Perfect location to watch the cricket in the afternoon and evening, as the sun is behind the grandstand, so no direct sunlight at all - which is a good thing! You are also directly opposite the scoreboard. Beer, soft drinks, ice creams, fast food - all located at the top of the Grandstand area, and also from the roaming vendors who walk the aisles. Just make sure you have lots of small notes to buy food with early on, as the vendors won't have much change to break large notes until later in the day. Toilet facilities were pretty good during the first match, but quickly deteriorated by the second match. Didn't really notice any cleaners about, which is probably my only area of feedback for improvement. Note - If you get tickets that sit on the side of the scoreboard (cheapest tickets for the stadium) you will be in direct full sunlight for day matches.

Dont get the tickets on the concrete steps! Thinks its C and D section. Very uncomfortable but the atmosphere was electric with Sri Lanka in the final. Well done West Indies. Not in the nicest area of Colombo but the children around the stadium were very friendly!
